page.title: 17DIDSBURY COLLEGE
page.content: On Thursday 22nd September 1842 Didsbury College became the first Theology College in Britain for training Methodist ministers. On October 1st 1940 the building was then used as a military hospital under the direction of the Red Cross and the Order of Saint John. It remained so for the duration of World War 2. On June 15th 1945 the Government made Didsbury College an emergency training college for teachers. the building was rented to the Manchester Education Committee by the Methodist Church. In 1965 it became known as Didsbury College of Education. In the 1970's Didsbury College became part of Manchester Polytechnic, and it has continued as a college for student teachers.
